channel.title: Tips for remembering the bones?
channel.description: Hello, This year in biology, I need to learn [s]all[/s] some of the bones in the human body. Pretty much this, give or take a few. [img]http://www.enchantedlearning.com/hgifs/Humanskel_bw.GIF[/img] Does anyone have any tips for remembering them? Thanks :) Justis

item.title: Tips for remembering the bones?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1-BLjXP_QX0

Lol sister was watching it.

[quote=“davidude36, post:2, topic:199154”]I’ve got a tip,
And i believe it goes a little something like this;

Oh those bones, oh those bones,
oh those skeleton bones.
Oh those bones, oh those bones,
oh those skeleton bones.
Oh those bones, oh those bones,
oh those skeleton bones.
Oh mercy how they scare!

With the toe bone connected
to the foot bone,
and the foot bone connected
to the ankle bone,
and the ankle bone connected
to the leg bone.
Oh mercy how they scare!

etc etc more at http://kids.niehs.nih.gov/lyrics/bones.htm[/quote]

Thats how i remember it.

Read full topic

Crank that skull dont be hating on maxilla then super mandible flew in cockin on vertabrae. Now I pass it to clavicle watch me crank that scapula, now watch me you punch on dem ribs, now you…humerus is for laughing…catch me at yo local party hating erey day, now lean to the left now lean to right now you crank that elbow now radius crank that!!! Pelvis boy up in dis hoe be and gay and raping sacrum ulna. I roll with carpal to jackoff, phalanges jocking on mah femur-penis. Patella, knee, tibia,fibula, they crank em erey day. Tarsals, Metatarsals made for kicking ass. Nope you kaint do it like me!

Shit.

FAIL. But you will repeat this 3 times and you wont forget.
[/quote]

Fuck … Off… And make sure to take your rap culture with you.[/quote]
Thats why I said it fails, cunt.

item.title: Tips for remembering the bones?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:1, topic:199154”]Hello,
This year in biology, I need to learn all of the bones in the human body. Pretty much this, give or take a few.

Does anyone have any tips for remembering them?
Thanks
Justis[/quote]

There are 206 bones in the human body. I doubt you’re memorizing them all. There’s the stirrup, the anvil, and the hammer, which are bones that aren’t referenced in your diagram.

But if you still need help a month afterwards, I’ll help you on the ones I know by heart.

Skull is obvious.
Mandible is commonly referred to as the lower jaw.
Humerus is near your funny bone, which is a nerve.
Elbow isn’t a bone lol.
The radius is the bone that twists around the ulna.
The wrist isn’t one bone lol.
Ribs you know, vertebrae you know, pelvis you know.
And I’m too lazy to help you with the rest.

Read full topic

item.title: Tips for remembering the bones?
item.dc:creator: @ryanandmatt ryanandmatt
item.description:
@ryanandmatt wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:5, topic:199154”]I got hit in the Skull, so my Maxilla started bleeding.
Then I puked out of my Mandible and my Vertebrae was leaving.
Clavicle, Scapula, Ribs, Humerus, remember these or you’ll get raped.
Elbow like Elton, Radius like Rapes, Pelvis like Elvis, that’s all to it, you little Sacrum Ulna.
I use my Carpal to cut my Wrist, my Phalanges to touch my Femur.
Patella, Knee, Tibia, Fibula, they suck so bad that I took the knife out.
Tarsals, Metatarsals, two words that made me use drugs.

LEARN THAT SONG AND YOU KNOW ALL OF THEM TY NP OMG:…[/quote]

that is just wrong…
click the button
